isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - ENGINE SYMPTOMS DIAGNOSTICS - Test Procedures - ECM Reset/ IDM Reset (Intermittent Engine Stumble)

svcproc.title: ECM Reset/ IDM Reset (Intermittent Engine Stumble)

para.emph: Glow plug lamp cycles ON while engine running
Glow plugs recycle while engine running
Miles driven are not logged if ECM reset occurs during current key cycle

svcprocinfo.para: An Electronic Control Module (ECM) reset occurs when the ECM momentarily reboots or is turned OFF and ON while the engine is operating.
If a reset occurs, the engine will momentarily stumble and the ECM will go through a normal KEY ON cycle. This includes the following:

item.para: Illuminate the WAIT TO START lamp

svcprocinfo.para: If the pedal is not at idle position when the reset occurs, a DTC is set and engine speed goes to low idle. The ECM will not allow accelerator pedal authority until the Accelerator Pedal Sensor (APS) is released.

An Injector Drive Module (IDM) reset will occur if power is lost to the circuits for IDM Logic or IDM Main Power while the engine is operating. If power is lost, the engine will miss and recover or stall. The APS will not be affected by this fault.
Momentary loss of power to the ECM or IDM may be caused by the following:

step1.para: Using the EST, check for DTCs for both the engine and chassis modules.

item.para: If DTC 626 (unexpected reset fault) or 534 (IDM relay voltage low) are present as active or inactive codes, continue with step 4.
If any other engine DTCs are active, perform appropriate diagnostics and repairs before continuing with these procedures.
If any chassis DTCs are active when checking the Electronic System Controller (ESC), perform appropriate diagnostics and repairs before continuing.

step1.para: Complete Test 3 (Fuel Pressure) on the Performance Diagnostics form EGED-250 or Section 6 of this manual.
Complete Test 4 (Fuel Inlet Restriction) on the Performance Diagnostics form EGED-250 or Section 6 of this manual.

para.emph: See Section 7 in this manual, the Chassis Electrical Circuit Diagram Manual and Electrical System Troubleshooting Guide for the model and year of the vehicle when performing the following steps.

step1.para: Check all ECM and IDM related fuses.
Check all Battery, VIGN and ground connections for the ECM and IDM.
Monitor ECM powers and grounds with breakout box under operator complaint conditions.
Monitor IDM powers and grounds with 12 Pin Breakout Harness under operator complaint conditions.
If root cause has not been identified in previous steps, continue diagnosis by performing the remaining steps on the Performance Diagnostics form EGED-250 or Section 6 of this manual.
